title: How to Make Jelly Bean Easter Nests

steps.headline: Prepare the muffin pan before beginning, so that you can use it straight away.
steps.description: Grease each hole in the pan to prevent the nests from sticking.

steps.headline: Place the marshmallows and butter or margarine into the saucepan.
steps.description: Place over a low heat. Stir together as the butter or margarine and marshmallows melt.

steps.headline: Add the chow-mein noodles to the melted mixture.
steps.description: Push around with the spoon to ensure the noodles are well covered.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Allow to cool enough so that you can touch the mixture with your fingers. Take a teaspoon or two of mixture and press into a muffin pan hole. Use your fingers to press into a nest shape.

steps.headline: Place the muffin pan into the refrigerator to chill the nests.
steps.description: When they have firmed up, they can be removed.

steps.headline: Add a few jellybeans into each nest.
steps.description: Serve on a platter. If giving as a gift, wrap each nest individually in clear cellophane and tie with a ribbon bow.

text: Prepare the muffin pan before beginning, so that you can use it straight away. Grease each hole in the pan to prevent the nests from sticking. Place the marshmallows and butter or margarine into the saucepan. Place over a low heat. Stir together as the butter or margarine and marshmallows melt. Add the chow-mein noodles to the melted mixture. Push around with the spoon to ensure the noodles are well covered. Remove from the heat. Allow to cool enough so that you can touch the mixture with your fingers. Take a teaspoon or two of mixture and press into a muffin pan hole. Use your fingers to press into a nest shape. Place the muffin pan into the refrigerator to chill the nests. When they have firmed up, they can be removed. Add a few jellybeans into each nest. Serve on a platter. If giving as a gift, wrap each nest individually in clear cellophane and tie with a ribbon bow. Finished.
